title: Tautology, Contradiction - Part 1
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: Let us consider a compound statement. A compound  statement as you all know we have been discussing,
can be represented as a Boolean expression like  this, right. Consider these three expressions.
Do you think one can come out with an expression  that is always true? Do you think any of these
fall into that category? Forget about that being  always true. What about a compound statement
that is always false? Which among these is  a compound statement that is always false?
